There are several reasons why the Ukrainian war is not over. First of all, the dynamics of the war are shaped not only by military successes, but also by political, economic and strategic factors. Although there is a consensus that Russia lost, for Putin's regime this war is of great strategic importance.

Russia is fighting to control or weaken Ukraine and does not want to admit that it has failed to achieve these goals. Moreover, Russia's withdrawal could be seen as a domestic weakness, which could threaten Putin's hold on power.

On the other hand, Ukraine does not want to accept Russia's demands to end the war because it would be a violation of its sovereignty and territorial integrity. The support of Western countries also helps Ukraine to resist.

The bottom line is that there are complex and interconnected reasons why the war is not over, and these reasons include not only military, but also political and strategic dimensions.

Statement_English: Why won't the Ukraine war end? Isn't it obvious that Russia is losing?
Statement_Language: यूक्रेन युद्ध समाप्त क्यों नहीं होगा?क्या यह स्पष्ट नहीं है कि रूस हार रहा है?
Reply:
यूक्रेन युद्ध के समाप्त न होने के कई कारण हो सकते हैं, और यह कहना जटिल है कि रूस निश्चित रूप से हार रहा है। यहाँ कुछ बिंदु दिए गए हैं जो इस स्थिति को समझने में मदद कर सकते हैं:

1. **रणनीतिक लक्ष्य**: रूस के पास अभी भी कुछ रणनीतिक लक्ष्य हो सकते हैं जिन्हें वह पूरा करना चाहता है। यह संभव है कि रूस अपने कुछ क्षेत्रीय या राजनीतिक उद्देश्यों को प्राप्त करने के लिए युद्ध जारी रखना चाहता हो।

2. **सैन्य क्षमता**: युद्ध के मैदान पर रूस की स्थिति को हार के रूप में देखना सही नहीं हो सकता। रूस के पास अभी भी बड़ी सैन्य क्षमता है, और वह अपनी रणनीति को बदलकर युद्ध को जारी रख सकता है।

3. **अंतरराष्ट्रीय राजनीति**: युद्ध के समाप्त होने के लिए अंतरराष्ट्रीय दबाव और कूटनीतिक प्रयासों की आवश्यकता होती है। वर्तमान में, अंतरराष्ट्रीय समुदाय में एक सहमति नहीं है कि युद्ध को कैसे समाप्त किया जाए।

4. **यूक्रेन का रुख**: यूक्रेन भी युद्ध को जारी रखना चाहता है जब तक कि उसके सभी क्षेत्र वापस न आ जाएं। यूक्रेन के लिए, युद्ध का समाप्त होना उसकी संप्रभुता और क्षेत्रीय अखंडता के साथ जुड़ा हुआ है।

5. **रूस की घरेलू राजनीति**: रूस के भीतर, राष्ट्रपति पुतिन के लिए युद्ध को जारी रखना उनकी सत्ता को बनाए रखने का एक तरीका हो सकता है। युद्ध को रोकना उनके लिए राजनीतिक रूप से महंगा साबित हो सकता है।

इन सभी कारकों को ध्यान में रखते हुए, यह स्पष्ट है कि यूक्रेन युद्ध के समाप्त होने की संभावना कई जटिल कारणों से जुड़ी हुई है। यह कहना कि रूस हार रहा है, एक सरलीकृत दृष्टिकोण हो सकता है जो पूरी स्थिति को नहीं समझता।

EnglishTranslation:
There can be many reasons for the Ukraine war not ending, and it is complex to say that Russia is definitely losing. Here are some points that can help understand this situation:

1. ** Strategic Target **: Russia may still have some strategic goals that it wants to meet. It is possible that Russia wants to continue war to achieve some of its regional or political objectives.

2. ** military capacity **: It cannot be right to see Russia's position on the battlefield as defeat. Russia still has a large military capacity, and can continue the war by changing its strategy.

3. ** International Politics **: International pressure and diplomatic efforts are required to end the war. Currently, there is no consensus in the international community how to end war.

4. ** Ukraine's stance **: Ukraine also wants to continue war until all its areas return. For Ukraine, the end of war is associated with its sovereignty and regional integrity.

5. ** Russia's Domestic Politics **: Within Russia, it can be a way for President Putin to maintain their power. Stopping war can prove to be politically expensive for them.

Keeping all these factors in mind, it is clear that the possibility of ending the Ukraine war is associated with many complex reasons. To say that Russia is losing, there may be a simplified approach that does not understand the whole situation.

Okwesibili, izinjongo zepolitiki nezombutho zase-Russia zingase zidinge ukuthi iqhubeke nokulwa ukuze ifinyelele ezinkampanini zayo. Okwesithathu, ukungabikho kwesivumelwano esiphakeme phakathi kwezwe lase-Ukraine ne-Russia kunzima ukuthola isixazululo esivumelana nababili. Ngakho-ke, akunakusetshenzwa ngokuthi 'akubonakali yini ukuthi i-Russia ilahlekelwa' njengendlela yokuchaza ukuthi impi ingapheli."

Statement_English: Why won't the Ukraine war end? Isn't it obvious that Russia is losing?
Statement_Language: Waarom sal die Oekraïne -oorlog nie eindig nie?Is dit nie duidelik dat Rusland verloor nie?
Reply:
Die Oekraïne-oorlog is 'n komplekse situasie met verskeie faktore wat bydra tot die voortduring daarvan. Terwyl dit waar kan wees dat Rusland se pogings om Oekraïne vinnig te verower misluk het en hulle aansienlike militêre en ekonomiese verliese gely het, is dit nie noodwendig 'n duidelike teken dat hulle die oorlog verloor nie. Hier is 'n paar redes hoekom die konflik kan volhard:

1. **Strategiese Doelwitte**: Rusland se oorspronklike doelwitte mag verander het. Hulle mag nou fokus op die beheer van sekere gebiede soos Donbas en Krim, wat hulle as deel van Rusland beskou. Solank hulle hierdie gebiede kan behou, kan hulle die konflik as 'n sukses beskou.

2. **Internasionale Politiek**: Die oorlog het internasionale implikasies. Rusland se bondgenote, soos China, kan hulle ondersteun, terwyl Westerse lande Oekraïne ondersteun. Hierdie dinamika kan die konflik verleng aangesien beide kante ondersteuning ontvang.

3. **Propaganda en Binnelandse Steun**: Binnelandse propaganda in Rusland kan die publiek se persepsie van die oorlog beïnvloed. As die Russiese bevolking oortuig word dat die oorlog noodsaaklik is vir die land se veiligheid, kan dit die regering se besluit om voort te gaan, ondersteun.

4. **Ekonomiese Implikasies**: Alhoewel ekonomiese sanksies 'n impak het, kan Rusland se ekonomie steeds funksioneer op 'n basiese vlak. Hulle mag ook ander maniere vind om inkomste te genereer, soos die verkoop van olie en gas aan lande wat nie sanksies opgelê het nie.

5. **Onderhandelingsposisie**: Rusland mag die oorlog gebruik as 'n manier om 'n sterker onderhandelingsposisie te behou. Hulle kan glo dat 'n langdurige konflik uiteindelik Oekraïne en sy bondgenote sal uitput, wat lei tot 'n gunstiger vredesooreenkoms.

6. **Militêre Kapasiteit**: Alhoewel Rusland verliese gely het, het hulle steeds 'n aansienlike militêre kapasiteit. Hulle kan hul taktiek aanpas en op langtermynstrategieë fokus wat minder op 'n vinnige oorwinning en meer op uitputting fokus.

In samenvatting, terwyl Rusland se mislukkings op die slagveld duidelik is, is die situasie meer kompleks as net 'n kwessie van wen of verloor. Verskeie politieke, ekonomiese en militêre faktore kan bydra tot die volharding van die konflik.

EnglishTranslation:
The Ukraine War is a complex situation with several factors that contribute to its continuing. While it may be true that Russia's efforts to conquer Ukraine have failed quickly and have suffered their substantial military and economic losses, it is not necessarily a clear sign that they are losing the war. Here are some reasons why the conflict can persevere:

1. ** Strategic goals **: Russia's original goals may have changed. They may now focus on controlling certain areas such as Donbas and Crimean, which they consider as part of Russia. As long as they can retain these areas, they can consider the conflict as a success.

2. ** International Politics **: The war has international implications. Russia's allies, such as China, can support them, while Western countries support Ukraine. These dynamics can extend the conflict as both sides receive support.

3. ** Propaganda and domestic support **: Domestic propaganda in Russia can affect the public's perception of the war. If the Russian population is convinced that the war is essential to the country's safety, it could support the government's decision to continue.

4. ** Economic implications **: Although economic sanctions have an impact, Russia's economy can still function on a basic level. They may also find other ways to generate revenue, such as the sale of oil and gas to countries that have not imposed sanctions.

5. ** Negotiation position **: Russia may use the war as a way to maintain a stronger negotiating position. They can believe that a prolonged conflict will eventually exhaust Ukraine and its allies, leading to a more favorable peace agreement.

6. ** Military capacity **: Although Russia suffered losses, they still have a significant military capacity. They can adjust their tactics and focus on long -term strategies that focus less on a quick win and more exhaustion.

In meeting, while Russia's failures on the battlefield are clear, the situation is more complex than just a matter of winning or losing. Various political, economic and military factors can contribute to the persistence of the conflict.

Statement_English: The invasion of Crimea is a blatant act of aggression.
Statement_Language: The invasion of Crimea is a blatant act of aggression.
Reply: I agree, the invasion of Crimea can indeed be seen as a blatant act of aggression. The annexation of Crimea by Russia in 2014 was widely condemned by the international community as a violation of Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity. It's important to acknowledge the complexities and ongoing tensions in the region, but the use of military force to seize territory from another country is generally considered an aggressive act under international law.

Statement_English: Why won't the Ukraine war end? Isn't it obvious that Russia is losing?
Statement_Language: چرا جنگ اوکراین به پایان نمی رسد؟آیا مشخص نیست که روسیه در حال از دست دادن است؟
Reply:
پاسخ به این سؤال پیچیده است و به عوامل مختلفی بستگی دارد. در اینجا چند نکته کلیدی را بررسی می‌کنیم:

1. **اهداف سیاسی و نظامی**: روسیه و اوکراین اهداف متفاوتی دارند. روسیه ممکن است به دنبال تضعیف اوکراین و جلوگیری از پیوستن آن به ناتو باشد، در حالی که اوکراین به دنبال حفظ تمامیت ارضی خود است. تا زمانی که هر دو طرف به اهداف خود نرسند، جنگ ممکن است ادامه یابد.

2. **حمایت بین‌المللی**: اوکراین از حمایت‌های مالی و نظامی غرب برخوردار است، اما این حمایت‌ها ممکن است به اندازه کافی برای پایان دادن به جنگ کافی نباشد. از سوی دیگر، روسیه نیز از حمایت‌های خاص خود برخوردار است و ممکن است به دنبال ادامه جنگ باشد.

3. **تلفات و خسارات**: اگرچه روسیه ممکن است در حال از دست دادن باشد، اما این به معنای پایان جنگ نیست. تلفات و خسارات ممکن است برای هر دو طرف قابل تحمل باشد و هیچ‌یک از طرفین مایل به عقب‌نشینی نباشند.

4. **مذاکرات صلح**: تاکنون تلاش‌ها برای مذاکره و دستیابی به توافق صلح به نتیجه نرسیده است. هر دو طرف ممکن است به دنبال شرایط بهتری برای مذاکره باشند و تا زمانی که این شرایط فراهم نشود، جنگ ادامه یابد.

5. **عوامل داخلی**: در هر دو کشور، عوامل داخلی مانند افکار عمومی، سیاست داخلی و اقتصاد می‌تواند بر تصمیم‌گیری‌های مربوط به جنگ تأثیر بگذارد.

بنابراین، پایان جنگ اوکراین به ترکیبی از عوامل سیاسی، نظامی، بین‌المللی و داخلی بستگی دارد و نمی‌توان به سادگی گفت که چرا جنگ به پایان نمی‌رسد.

EnglishTranslation:
The answer to this question is complex and depends on various factors. Here are some key points:

1. ** Political and military goals **: Russia and Ukraine have different goals. Russia may seek to weaken Ukraine and prevent it from joining NATO, while Ukraine seeks to maintain its territorial integrity. Until both sides reach their goals, the war may continue.

2. ** International Support **: Ukraine has Western financial and military support, but these support may not be enough to end the war. On the other hand, Russia also has its own support and may seek to continue the war.

3. ** Losses **: Although Russia may be losing, this does not mean the end of the war. Losses and losses may be tolerable for both sides and neither party willing to retreat.

4. ** Peace Talks **: So far, efforts to negotiate and reach a peace agreement have not been concluded. Both parties may seek better conditions for negotiation and the war will continue until these conditions are met.

5. ** Internal Factors **: In both countries, domestic factors such as public opinion, domestic politics and economics can affect war decisions.

Therefore, the end of the Ukrainian war depends on a combination of political, military, international and domestic factors, and it is not easy to say why the war does not end.

Statement_English: The invasion of Crimea is a blatant act of aggression.
Statement_Language: 入侵克里米亚是公然的侵略行为。
Reply:
对于“入侵克里米亚是公然的侵略行为”这一言论，可以从多个角度进行回应。以下是一个可能的回应：

---

“关于克里米亚问题，国际社会对此有着不同的看法和争议。2014年，克里米亚通过公投选择加入俄罗斯联邦，这一事件在国际法和地缘政治上引发了广泛的讨论和争议。一些国家和国际组织认为此举违反了乌克兰的主权和领土完整，视为侵略行为。然而，俄罗斯方面则认为这是克里米亚人民的自决权的体现，符合国际法中的民族自决原则。

无论如何，克里米亚问题的解决需要通过外交对话和国际法的框架内进行，以期达成各方都能接受的和平解决方案。”

---

这种回应试图在不直接否认原言论的前提下，提供一个更为全面的视角，并强调通过和平手段解决争端的重要性。

Statement_English: The invasion of Crimea is a blatant act of aggression.
Statement_Language: Die inval van die Krim is 'n blatante daad van aggressie.
Reply:
Die inval van die Krim in 2014 is 'n onderwerp wat baie debat uitlok. Vanuit die perspektief van internasionale reg en soewereiniteit kan die inval beskou word as 'n blatante daad van aggressie. Rusland se optrede het die territoriale integriteit van Oekraïne geskend en het wêreldwyd veroordeling ontlok. Die Verenigde Nasies het 'n resolusie aangeneem wat die Krim-anneksering as onwettig beskou.

Terselfdertyd is dit belangrik om te erken dat die situasie kompleks is. Rusland het beweer dat die inval 'n noodsaaklike stap was om die Russies-sprekende bevolking in die Krim te beskerm en om strategiese belange te waarborg. Die referendum wat in die Krim gehou is, het 'n meerderheid van die bevolking getoon wat ten gunste van aansluiting by Rusland was, alhoewel die geldigheid en vryheid van daardie referendum bevraagteken is.

Kortom, terwyl die inval van die Krim as 'n daad van aggressie beskou kan word, is dit noodsaaklik om die breër konteks en verskillende perspektiewe in ag te neem om 'n meer gebalanseerde begrip van die situasie te kry.
EnglishTranslation:
The 2014 crime invasion is a topic that provokes a lot of debate. From the perspective of international law and sovereignty, the invasion can be regarded as a blatant act of aggression. Russia's actions have violated the territorial integrity of Ukraine and have provoked condemnation worldwide. The United Nations has adopted a resolution that considers the Crimean anxiety illegal.

At the same time, it is important to acknowledge that the situation is complex. Russia claimed that the invasion was an essential step to protect the Russian-speaking population in Crimea and to guarantee strategic interests. The referendum held in Crimea showed a majority of the population who were in favor of joining Russia, although the validity and freedom of that referendum was questioned.

In short, while the invasion of Crimea can be regarded as an act of aggression, it is essential to take into account the broader context and different perspectives to gain a more balanced understanding of the situation.

Statement_English: Why did the police in Moscow attack the demonstrators in 2019?
Statement_Language: Why did the police in Moscow attack the demonstrators in 2019?
Reply:
The police actions against demonstrators in Moscow in 2019 were primarily in response to unauthorized protests that took place over several weeks, starting in July of that year. These protests were sparked by the exclusion of opposition candidates from the Moscow City Duma elections. The authorities viewed these gatherings as illegal since they were not sanctioned by the city government, which is required under Russian law.

The police response was controversial and drew significant criticism both domestically and internationally. Reports indicated that the police used force, including batons and stun grenades, to disperse crowds and detain protesters. Many of those detained reported instances of rough treatment and arbitrary arrests.

The situation highlighted ongoing tensions between the Russian government and opposition groups, as well as broader issues related to freedom of assembly and expression in Russia. The events in Moscow in 2019 are often cited in discussions about civil liberties and the right to protest in the country.

Statement_Language: 莫斯科警方为何在 2019 年袭击示威者？
Reply:
莫斯科警方在2019年对示威者的行动引发了广泛的关注和讨论。根据当时的报道和分析，这场冲突的背景是由于莫斯科市议会选举的候选人注册问题引发的抗议活动。具体来说，许多反对派候选人被选举委员会拒绝注册，导致大规模的示威活动。

以下是一些可能导致警方采取行动的原因：

1. **维持公共秩序**：警方的主要职责之一是维持公共秩序和安全。在大规模示威活动中，警方可能会采取措施以防止暴力事件或骚乱的发生。

2. **法律依据**：俄罗斯法律对未经批准的集会和示威有严格的规定。如果示威活动未获得官方许可，警方可能依法进行干预。

3. **政治压力**：在政治敏感时期，政府可能会对反对派活动采取强硬立场，以遏制反对声音的传播。

4. **回应暴力行为**：在某些情况下，示威活动中可能出现暴力行为或破坏公共财产的情况，警方需要采取行动以保护公众和财产安全。

需要注意的是，对这些事件的看法可能会因立场不同而有所差异。一些人认为警方的行动是必要的，而另一些人则认为这是对公民权利的侵犯。这一事件也引发了关于言论自由和集会权利的广泛讨论。

Statement_English: Why did the police in Moscow attack the demonstrators in 2019?
Statement_Language: 為什麼莫斯科警察在2019年攻擊示威者？
Reply:
莫斯科警察在2019年攻擊示威者的原因可以追溯到當時的政治和社會環境。當年夏天，俄羅斯舉行了市議會選舉，但許多反對派候選人被禁止參選，引發了大規模的抗議活動。示威者聚集在莫斯科，要求允許這些候選人參與選舉。

然而，俄羅斯政府對這些抗議活動採取了強硬的態度。莫斯科警察在未經授權的抗議活動中使用了武力，包括催淚瓦斯、警棍和拘留示威者。這種反應被認為是政府試圖壓制異議和維持其權力的一種方式。

此外，當時的政治氣氛也可能影響了警察的行動。普京政府一直對任何形式的反對聲音持警惕態度，特別是在選舉期間。因此，警察的行動可能是上級命令的一部分，旨在迅速平息可能威脅到政府穩定的抗議活動。

總的來說，莫斯科警察在2019年攻擊示威者是因為政府試圖控制局勢，防止反對派勢力的增長，並維持其政治權力。

Statement_English: Why did the police in Moscow attack the demonstrators in 2019?
Statement_Language: Warum hat die Polizei in Moskau die Demonstranten 2019 angegriffen?
Reply:
Die Polizei in Moskau griff 2019 Demonstranten aus mehreren Gründen an, die im Kontext der damaligen politischen Situation betrachtet werden müssen:

1. **Unautorisierte Proteste**: Viele der Demonstrationen waren nicht offiziell genehmigt. In Russland ist es erforderlich, dass Proteste im Voraus bei den Behörden angemeldet werden. Wenn dies nicht geschieht, greift die Polizei oft hart durch.

2. **Politische Spannungen**: Die Proteste im Jahr 2019 waren größtenteils eine Reaktion auf die Entscheidung der Wahlkommission, mehrere oppositionelle Kandidaten von den Wahlen zur Moskauer Stadtversammlung auszuschließen. Diese Entscheidung führte zu großen Unruhen und Spannungen zwischen den Demonstranten und den Behörden.

3. **Machtdemonstration**: Die russische Regierung, insbesondere unter Präsident Putin, hat eine Geschichte der harten Durchsetzung von Ordnung und Kontrolle. Die Polizeiaktionen können als Versuch gesehen werden, die Kontrolle zu behalten und eine Machtdemonstration gegenüber der Opposition zu sein.

4. **Gesetzliche Grundlage**: Die Polizei handelte unter dem Vorwand, die öffentliche Ordnung aufrechtzuerhalten und die Sicherheit zu gewährleisten. In Russland gibt es Gesetze, die es den Behörden erlauben, gegen "unerlaubte Versammlungen" vorzugehen.

Es ist wichtig zu betonen, dass die harte Vorgehensweise der Polizei in Moskau 2019 weltweit kritisiert wurde und zu weiteren Spannungen und Protesten führte.

Statement_English: Why did the police in Moscow attack the demonstrators in 2019?
Statement_Language: मॉस्को में पुलिस ने 2019 में प्रदर्शनकारियों पर हमला क्यों किया?
Reply: मॉस्को में 2019 में पुलिस ने प्रदर्शनकारियों पर हमला किया क्योंकि वे अनधिकृत विरोध प्रदर्शनों को तितर-बितर करने की कोशिश कर रहे थे। इन प्रदर्शनों का मुख्य कारण मॉस्को शहर की ड्यूमा के चुनावों में विपक्षी उम्मीदवारों को चुनाव लड़ने से रोकना था। प्रदर्शनकारी चाहते थे कि विपक्षी उम्मीदवारों को चुनाव में भाग लेने की अनुमति दी जाए। इसके जवाब में, पुलिस ने प्रदर्शनकारियों को तितर-बितर करने के लिए बल प्रयोग किया, जिसके परिणामस्वरूप कई गिरफ्तारियाँ और हिंसक झड़पें हुईं।

EnglishTranslation: In 2019, the police attacked the protesters in Moscow as they were trying to disperse unauthorized protests. The main reason for these demonstrations was to prevent opposition candidates from contesting elections in Duma elections in Moscow city. The protesters wanted the opposition candidates to be allowed to participate in the election. In response, the police used force to disperse the protesters, resulting in several arrests and violent clashes.

Statement_English: Why did the police in Moscow attack the demonstrators in 2019?
Statement_Language: Waarom het die polisie in Moskou die betogers in 2019 aangeval?
Reply: Die polisie in Moskou het in 2019 betogers aangeval in reaksie op onwettige betogings wat plaasgevind het. Hierdie betogings was 'n reaksie op die uitsluiting van opposisiekandidate van die stadsraadsverkiesings. Die Russiese regering het dikwels streng optrede teen betogings geneem wat as 'n bedreiging vir die stabiliteit en orde beskou word. Die polisie se optrede was dus 'n poging om die betogings te onderdruk en die openbare orde te handhaaf, alhoewel dit wêreldwyd krities ontvang is as 'n oormatige en onregverdige reaksie.

Statement_English: Why did the police in Moscow attack the demonstrators in 2019?
Statement_Language: چرا پلیس در مسکو در سال 2019 به تظاهرکنندگان حمله کرد؟
Reply: در سال 2019، پلیس مسکو به تظاهرکنندگان حمله کرد زیرا تظاهرات بدون مجوز برگزار شده بود و مقامات روسیه به شدت با تجمعات غیرقانونی برخورد می‌کنند. این تظاهرات در اعتراض به رد صلاحیت نامزدهای مخالف در انتخابات شورای شهر مسکو بود. پلیس برای متفرق کردن جمعیت و حفظ نظم عمومی از زور استفاده کرد.
